page.title: 13Landscape
page.content: The limestone hills of Moel Hiraddug 264 metres,Graig Fach and Graig Fawr dominate the landscape,and have in the past been ideal settlement sites. An Iron Age hill fort is found at Moel Hiraddug. A Castle was constructed at Graig Fach.The limestone has been quarried extensively for its rock and for lime,and this is the reason for the disappearance of the Castle. Abandoned mines and shafts testify to the intensity of mining for iron, lead,copper and zinc. An Engine House still remains on the Talargorch site,near Meliden. These quarries and mines influenced the L+N.W.R.to build a Branch Line from Prestatyn to Meliden and Dyserth in 1884.The line closed in 1973 and the track was removed in 1980.
